intro: Delissea eleeleensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy soils and saline environments. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Delissea eleeleensis is an important component of Hawaii's coastal ecosystems and is often found in areas with strong oceanic influences.
